(5)

deviation of 10 kg.

and a half times the weight of a randomly chosen adult woman.

5.  a researcher is hired by a cleaning company to survey the opinions of employees on a 
proposed pension scheme. the company employs 55 managers and 495 cleaners. 
 
to collect data the researcher decides to give a questionnaire to the first 50 cleaners to 
leave at the end of the day.
 
(a) give 2 reasons why this method is likely to produce biased results.
(2)
 
(b) explain briefly how the researcher could select a sample of 50 employees using
 
 
(i)  a systematic sample,
 
 
(ii) a stratified sample.
(6)
 
using the random number tables in the formulae book, and starting with the top left hand 
corner (8) and working across, 50 random numbers between 1 and 550 inclusive were 
selected. the first two suitable numbers are 384 and 100.
  
(c) find the next two suitable numbers. 
(2)
